data.title: Meh.
data.text: My visit was during lunch and it was crowded and loud - not generally that much of an issue for me - but, y'all, I'm pretty sure their dining area would have given the fire marshal a coronary.  The food is so-so, as was the service.  There are much better seafood and Mexican restos in Lake Charles, I say, skip.

data.title: Our first visit
data.text:
had been wanting to get here and finally did.  We were seated immediately and Skyler introduced herself as our waitress.  We ordered boudin balls as an appetizer and they were very good.  My wife got the shrimp po'boy and cup of seafood gumbo and she liked them both very much.  I had the Tilapia Pontchartrain and the fish and topping was wonderful.  It came with steamed veggies.  I ate the peppers but I'm not into squash and cucumbers so there were a lot of them left when I was done with the fish.

Skyler was very attentive to our table.  We enjoyed our visit and will be back in the future.

data.title: Good foodcand atmosphere
data.text: We had 6 in our group.  We arrived a little before 6pm on a Saturday evening and sat immediately. A little later the restaurant was full Jake our server was excellent. Everyone enjoyed their food.  The fried fish was perfect.  Recommend for some good food in a great atmosphere.  We had an opportunity to meet the owner who was very pleasant.

data.title: Date night
data.text: My wife had the grilled vegetables and shrimp. It was delicious. The veg and shrimp were seasoned very well and the shrimp were very good size. The fried boudian balls were the best eat we had ever had not just all rice. I had the catfish and shrimp and should have got the smaller one, cooked perfectly. The atmosphere was casual and fun. Great music and interesting decor. The staff was very friendly and the service was great. Would diffidently going back.

data.title: Fabulous Fusion with a Flair of Louisiana and Tex-Mex
data.text: On a rainy night, we visited with our friends one of their favorite places in downtown. Parking was not available on the street but there was a nearby parking lot.  We were offered the prime table for 4 in the front window and greeted by a handsome and friendly server.  We immediately ordered their special Bayou Margarita made with the local Bayou Satsuma Rum and they were addictive, we ordered seconds.  The chips and salsa were also unique as the chips were sprinkled with some type of seasoning.  Our friends highly recommended that we try the Bangin Boudin Quesadillas layered with shrimp and a special sauce. We were glad that we followed orders, it was a deliciously unique experience.  The atmosphere was stimulating with brightly colored and tasteful decor and music from the past.  There was a bar area and a long strip of well spaced tables.  The prices were reasonable and the quantity of food was substantial, our bellies were full and we had no room for dessert.  Our friends also shared that the gumbo was excellent and that is a great recommendation from Cajuns.

data.title: wow... DELICIOUS!!!
data.text: So, takig the family to the Children's musuem and of course we are hungry and need to eat first. We are from out of town, so I hooked a left on Ryan St. and started looking for a local place to eat. We decided on this place and man, I am glad we did. We had the chips, salsa and boudin balls to start, they were good. We all 4 had something different and it did not disappoint. From the catfish po boy and gumbo to the roast beef po boy to the popcorn shrimp my youngest had, to the salad. It was all good. This will definitely be a place we return to when we come in town to visit. The waitress we had gave really good recommendations and was knowledgeable.

data.title: Fun place!
data.text: Stopped for dinner on a weeknight and we're seated right away and the service was quite fast. The food was AMAZING! I had a po boy that was huge. The people that I went with also were left quite full! Plenty to look at on the walls and friendly service.

data.title: Fun, funky, FABULOUS!
data.text: Great place to kick-start your evening or have a energized lunch! Tia's has a wide variety of dishes that are sure to please! I've tried to order something different each time I've been, and I've never been disappointed. I have to say that the shrimp quesadillas are my favorite! VERY large portions, I always leave with a "doggy" bag. Try the boudain quesadillas for a treat you won't find any other place! The adult drinks are to die for- the Satsuma Margarita is superb (made with a shot of the locally made Bayou Rum )! Just have a designated driver! Susan, the owner floats about, greeting guests and making new friends...she's a doll! A fun place with exceptional food and lovely service!

data.title: A refreshing Surprise
data.text: This restaurant makes the most of the area it occupies in downtown Lake Charles. It surprised a local how well people are seated for an enjoyable meal in this friendly place. The food choices are unique using a cuisine that locals enjoy but with a little twist. The service was great and the friendly owner even walks around to make sure everyone is satisfied.

data.title: perfect
data.text: Everything  was fresh with fresh ingredients .  Salsa was not bland. Had a wonderful  margarita with freshly  squeezed  limes. Guacamole  great.  Had the boudin. Quesadillas. Was going to order fish tacos but got too full. Definitely  want to go back to try more off he menu.

data.title: Yummy Fish Tacos!
data.text: I'm normally not a fan of fish tacos but Tia Jaunitas' does them perfectly! The restaurant has a nice decor but is a little cramped. Plus Tia's has the best salsa in town.

data.title: Not fancy but fun! Good atmosphere.
data.text: Fairly expansive menu with lots of fish & seafood choices among other food items such as gumbo & tacos. Good appetizer list. The menu offers choices suitable for anyone to find something that suits their tastes & dietary restrictions. I had the shrimp taco's, which were good. They were fresh & had a jalapeño ranch sauce that was good. Only thing of mention is the shrimp are quite small & this close to the gulf I would have expected much bigger shrimp. They were cooked well so no complaints in that regard. Chips & salsa are great. Salsa is nice & spicy. Our service was great & our food arrived in a timely manner.

data.title: Best kept little secret!!!
data.text: This place is the best! Definitely a must. Prices very reasonable, portions are great, drinks are good, the staff is amazing from the time you walk in the door, the salsa is absolutely wonderful and the jalapeno ranch spectacular! Do yourself a favor and visit this place... the fish tacos are awesome.

data.title: Anniversary Dinner
data.text: Mexican Cajun food. Neat little restaurant with friendly staff!! Shrimp tacos are great! Chips & homemade salsa was really good too!!

data.title: Best Salsa !!
data.text: Great little dive. .awesome chips and salsa..I have the Boudin Quesadillas and they were awesome..my husband had the fish tacos and was completely won over...kinda pricey but well worth it in my opinion. .owner was extremely nice and very welcoming to our party ..will definitely be back

data.title: Yummy Margaritas
data.text: Shrimp tacos and strawberry margaritas, need I say more!? Super friendly wait staff! Welcomed us, as it was our first time in Louisiana. Would love to come back and try the satsuma margarita.

data.title: Boudin Quesdilla!!!!
data.text:
My husband and I were able to have a date night and we went to eat at Tia Juanita's in downtown Lake Charles. I've been hearing nothing but good reviews on the food. 
I got a large margarita and we got boudin quesadilla for an appetizer. I found the price to be a little higher than what I was expecting for it... UNTIL I TASTED IT! WOOT. The taste is well worth the 12.95. I order fish tacos on flour tortillas and my husband got the seafood gumbo. The gumbo was wonderful and the fish tacos were perfect. I love the jalapeno ranch that was added on my tacos. 
My margarita was wonderful and strong.  We will be back.

data.title: Great food!!
data.text: The staff is very friendly!  We love this place!!!!  The food here is fantastic!!  I love the fried catfish and their chips and salsa is wonderful!!

data.title: First time to eat at Tia Juanita's Fish Camp
data.text: Went to Tia Juanita's for lunch and really enjoyed the food.  It is a small trendy seafood restaurant in downtown Lake Charles .  We had fish and shrimp tacos with their homemade pico sauce with chips.  It was all good and we enjoyed the food.  The cost was like $10. for the Tacos and you get three of them with a cup of beans. Give it a chance.

data.title: Good tacos
data.text:
We have gone twice since they opened. The tacos are good but nothing special. The sauce they put on them is the best part. 

It is a very small place and the tables are kind of crowded.
